### getAnalysisUsage() {#ab30c2f24f66704c3debfd08a32e6710e}

<MemberDefinition

  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
getAnalysisUsage - Subclasses that override getAnalysisUsage must call this.

For MachineFunctionPasses, calling AU.preservesCFG() indicates that the pass does not modify the MachineBasicBlock CFG.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppcreducecrlogicals-cpp/#l00428">428</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppcreducecrlogicals-cpp">PPCReduceCRLogicals.cpp</a>.

### lookThroughCRCopy() {#a24fbb3a26fc0fcefed74db2072222bb5}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>MachineInstr &#42; anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;PPCReduceCRLogicals.cpp&#125;::PPCReduceCRLogicals::lookThroughCRCopy (unsigned Reg, unsigned &amp; Subreg, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a> &#42;&amp; CpDef)</>}>
Looks through a COPY instruction to the actual definition of the CR-bit register and returns the instruction that defines it.

FIXME: This currently handles what is by-far the most common case: an instruction that defines a CR field followed by a single copy of a bit from that field into a virtual register. If chains of copies need to be handled, this should have a loop until a non-copy instruction is found.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppcreducecrlogicals-cpp/#l00412">412</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppcreducecrlogicals-cpp">PPCReduceCRLogicals.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppcreducecrlogicals-cpp/#l00387">387</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppcreducecrlogicals-cpp">PPCReduceCRLogicals.cpp</a>.

### handleCROp() {#a6a4f820e50ea74a8951fd87f043029c1}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;PPCReduceCRLogicals.cpp&#125;::PPCReduceCRLogicals::handleCROp (unsigned Idx)</>}>
Contains all the implemented transformations on CR logical operations.

For example, a binary CR logical can be used to split a block on its inputs, a unary CR logical might be used to change the condition code on a comparison feeding it. A nullary CR logical might simply be removable if the user of the bit it &#91;un&#93;sets can be transformed.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppcreducecrlogicals-cpp/#l00388">388</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppcreducecrlogicals-cpp">PPCReduceCRLogicals.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### splitBlockOnBinaryCROp() {#adb3339bc4d4b77ab994c2af1150ad6e1}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;PPCReduceCRLogicals.cpp&#125;::PPCReduceCRLogicals::splitBlockOnBinaryCROp (<a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-ppcreducecrlogicals-cpp-/ppcreducecrlogicals/crlogicalopinfo">CRLogicalOpInfo</a> &amp; CRI)</>}>
Splits a block that contains a CR-logical operation that feeds a branch and whose operands are produced within the block.

Example: vr5&lt;def&gt; = CMPDI vr2, 0; CRRC:vr5 G8RC:vr2 vr6&lt;def&gt; = COPY vr5:sub&#95;eq; CRBITRC:vr6 CRRC:vr5 vr7&lt;def&gt; = CMPDI vr3, 0; CRRC:vr7 G8RC:vr3 vr8&lt;def&gt; = COPY vr7:sub&#95;eq; CRBITRC:vr8 CRRC:vr7 vr9&lt;def&gt; = CROR vr6&lt;kill&gt;, vr8&lt;kill&gt;; CRBITRC:vr9,vr6,vr8 BC vr9&lt;kill&gt;, &lt;BB#2&gt;; CRBITRC:vr9 Becomes: vr5&lt;def&gt; = CMPDI vr2, 0; CRRC:vr5 G8RC:vr2 vr6&lt;def&gt; = COPY vr5:sub&#95;eq; CRBITRC:vr6 CRRC:vr5 BC vr6&lt;kill&gt;, &lt;BB#2&gt;; CRBITRC:vr6

vr7&lt;def&gt; = CMPDI vr3, 0; CRRC:vr7 G8RC:vr3 vr8&lt;def&gt; = COPY vr7:sub&#95;eq; CRBITRC:vr8 CRRC:vr7 BC vr9&lt;kill&gt;, &lt;BB#2&gt;; CRBITRC:vr9

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppcreducecrlogicals-cpp/#l00389">389</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/powerpc/ppcreducecrlogicals-cpp">PPCReduceCRLogicals.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>
